title: Read
data:
By pressing [r](/wiki/R "R") you can **read** something.

[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") allows [you](/wiki/You "You") to read [objects](/wiki/Object "Object") in your [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory"):

- [fortune cookies](/wiki/Fortune_cookie "Fortune cookie"), to read the fortune without eating the cookie.
- [T-shirts](/wiki/T-shirt "T-shirt") and [alchemy smocks](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), to examine the message on each item.
- [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), to activate them.
- [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"), to study them.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- [credit cards](/wiki/Credit_card "Credit card")
- [magic markers](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")
- [gold pieces](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece")
- [the Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate")
- [candy bars](/wiki/Candy_bar "Candy bar")

You can try unsuccessfully to read other classes of objects.

In vanilla NetHack, you automatically read any floor [engravings](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") or [headstones](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone") that you encounter. This does not use the [r](/wiki/R "R") command, nor does it break [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"). (Though *reading* an engraving does not break the conduct, *[writing](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave")* one does.)

## NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), you automatically read any floor engravings, but not headstones.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) To read headstones, press [r](/wiki/R "R") and then answer [y](/wiki/Y "Y") to the question, *"Do you want to read an epitaph on the grave?"* In brass 040923, reading the epitaph does not break illiterate conduct.

## SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") requires you to explicitly read floor engravings and headstones, by pressing [r](/wiki/R "R"). Doing so breaks the illiterate conduct.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

By pressing [r](/wiki/R "R") then [,](/wiki/, ","), you can read objects that are on the floor. Thus, if you suddenly need to flee and you have no empty inventory slots, but luckily found a [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") on the floor, SLASH'EM lets you activate it.

SLASH'EM lets you "read" [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring"). This is a feature to check the color of rings that you are currently wearing, otherwise *"You can't see it!"* or *"Perhaps you should put it on first."* Currently, only a [mood ring](/wiki/Mood_ring "Mood ring") will glow with color; any other ring gives the message, *"There seems to be nothing special about this ring."*[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [read.c](/wiki/Read.c "Read.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) NetHack brass 040923/engrave.c#line212
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [engrave.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 372](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/engrave.c#line372 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/engrave.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [read.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 80](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/read.c#line80 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/read.c")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Read

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

By pressing r you can read something.

NetHack allows you to read objects in your inventory:

  • fortune cookies, to read the fortune without eating the cookie.
  • T-shirts and alchemy smocks, to examine the message on each item.
  • scrolls, to activate them.
  • spellbooks, to study them.[1]
  • credit cards
  • magic markers
  • gold pieces
  • the Orb of Fate
  • candy bars

You can try unsuccessfully to read other classes of objects.

In vanilla NetHack, you automatically read any floor engravings or headstones that you encounter. This does not use the r command, nor does it break illiterate conduct. (Though reading an engraving does not break the conduct, writing one does.)

NetHack brass

In NetHack brass, you automatically read any floor engravings, but not headstones.[2] To read headstones, press r and then answer y to the question, "Do you want to read an epitaph on the grave?" In brass 040923, reading the epitaph does not break illiterate conduct.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM requires you to explicitly read floor engravings and headstones, by pressing r. Doing so breaks the illiterate conduct.[3]

By pressing r then ,, you can read objects that are on the floor. Thus, if you suddenly need to flee and you have no empty inventory slots, but luckily found a scroll of teleportation on the floor, SLASH'EM lets you activate it.

SLASH'EM lets you "read" rings. This is a feature to check the color of rings that you are currently wearing, otherwise "You can't see it!" or "Perhaps you should put it on first." Currently, only a mood ring will glow with color; any other ring gives the message, "There seems to be nothing special about this ring."[4]

References

  1. ↑ read.c
  2. ↑ NetHack brass 040923/engrave.c#line212
  3. ↑ engrave.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 372
  4. ↑ read.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 80

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
By pressing {{kbd|r}} you can '''read''' something.

[[NetHack]] allows [[you]] to read [[object]]s in your [[inventory]]:
* [[fortune cookie]]s, to read the fortune without eating the cookie.
* [[T-shirt]]s and [[alchemy smock]]s, to examine the message on each item.
* [[scroll]]s, to activate them.
* [[spellbook]]s, to study them.<ref>[[read.c]]</ref>
* [[credit card]]s
* [[magic marker]]s
* [[gold piece]]s
* [[the Orb of Fate]]
* [[candy bar]]s

You can try unsuccessfully to read other classes of objects.

In vanilla NetHack, you automatically read any floor [[engraving]]s or [[headstone]]s that you encounter. This does not use the {{kbd|r}} command, nor does it break [[illiterate]] [[conduct]]. (Though ''reading'' an engraving does not break the conduct, ''[[engrave|writing]]'' one does.)

== NetHack brass ==
In [[NetHack brass]], you automatically read any floor engravings, but not headstones.<ref>NetHack brass 040923/engrave.c#line212</ref> To read headstones, press {{kbd|r}} and then answer {{kbd|y}} to the question, ''"Do you want to read an epitaph on the grave?"'' In brass 040923, reading the epitaph does not break illiterate conduct.

== SLASH'EM ==
[[SLASH'EM]] requires you to explicitly read floor engravings and headstones, by pressing {{kbd|r}}. Doing so breaks the illiterate conduct.{{refsrc|engrave.c|372|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

By pressing {{kbd|r}} then {{kbd|,}}, you can read objects that are on the floor. Thus, if you suddenly need to flee and you have no empty inventory slots, but luckily found a [[scroll of teleportation]] on the floor, SLASH'EM lets you activate it.

SLASH'EM lets you "read" [[ring]]s. This is a feature to check the color of rings that you are currently wearing, otherwise ''"You can't see it!"'' or ''"Perhaps you should put it on first."'' Currently, only a [[mood ring]] will glow with color; any other ring gives the message, ''"There seems to be nothing special about this ring."''{{refsrc|read.c|80|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
